qas.question: What sits on top of the Main Building at Notre Dame?

answers.text: a golden statue of the Virgin Mary

qas.question: What is in front of the Notre Dame Main Building?
The Basilica of the Sacred heart at Notre Dame is beside to which structure?
What is the Grotto at Notre Dame?

answers.text: a Marian place of prayer and reflection

qas.question: To whom did the Virgin Mary allegedly appear in 1858 in Lourdes France?

context: Architecturally, the school has a Catholic character. Atop the Main Building's gold dome is <a0_0>a golden statue of the Virgin Mary<a0_0/>. Immediately in front of the Main Building and facing it, is <a1_0>a copper statue of Christ<a1_0/> with arms upraised with the legend "Venite Ad Me Omnes". Next to <a2_0>the Main Building<a2_0/> is the Basilica of the Sacred Heart. Immediately behind the basilica is the Grotto, <a3_0>a Marian place of prayer and reflection<a3_0/>. It is a replica of the grotto at Lourdes, France where the Virgin Mary reputedly appeared to <a4_0>Saint Bernadette Soubirous<a4_0/> in 1858. At the end of the main drive (and in a direct line that connects through 3 statues and the Gold Dome), is a simple, modern stone statue of Mary.
